definition: perfectly sound proposition/unalterable truth/irrefutable argument
(negative prefix)/not/no
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"

(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom)/concise and powerful style
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
obvious/clear for all to see

without proof one can't believe it (idiom)
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
